message: OK - I'm about to link to a screencap of what I have so far for your review
/cc @etmaguire
Yeah where it says "Here is some chatter from Convore" - that actually is from Convore

Almost done with the WP plugin and I screencapped the dino logo from the upper left of the screen for development but I was wondering if there was an official small logo for use with third party web sites (ie. for a WP plugin to link to a topic on Convore from a post)?

OK here is a link to what I'm talking about - alas the screen capture here doesn't show the On Hover for the logo that implies that it's clickable and links you to the topic http://www.michaelridley.info/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/screenshot-3.png
@mridley I think we've got one, but I don't know for sure
@mridley Eric will be able to chime in
@mridley Cool!
Neat :)
We're decoding it, are you sure it's not being double-encoded?
http://www.michaelridley.info/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/screenshot-1.png
That's really cool!
hmm
@mridley Does that fill in with some messages?
http://www.michaelridley.info/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/screenshot-2.png

although I am still having that issue with text encoding - I call PHP's urlencode() to escape stuff like "&" in the WP post topic but when I pass that to Convore the Convore topic has the escaped content
it might be - I will look at it further - haven't touched that code in a few days, may be doing something wrong on my end
and then it automatically creates Convore topics when you create posts (well there's an option about what you want the default to be)
The dino logo links you to the topic

only thing that's not ideal is right now the Convore discussion replaces the existing comments.  Would be nice to have them coexist but this is my first WP plugin so it's not apparent to me the best way to do that.  But it will be open source so whatever, other people can improve it

If I remove my encoding then the topic is truncated on "&"  But if I add encoding I get topics like More%20%26%23038%3B%20More  So I dunno...but it doesn't seem to be double encoded.  The API I'm hitting in this case is https://convore.com/api/groups/:group_id/topics/create.json
Thanks!  Hopefully will have it ready to release and upload to WP plugins directory today

@ericflo Looked again - does not seem to be double encoded.  I'll keep looking into it - I must be missing something obvious if you are decoding on your end.  Just not sure yet what obvious thing I'm missing...
